avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. The snowpack is considered stable. Slight new snow forcasted the next days. Thinn wind slabs may form in gullies and lows in W-facing aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. The snowpack is considered stable after the thaw and rain the last days. Slight new snow forcasted the next days. Thinn wind slabs may form in gullies and lows in W-facing aspects. Mountaineers are advised to be careful where slabs might accumulate in terrain traps.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in east Iceland on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. High avalanche danger is expected as the weather is passing, and wind slabs will likely form in gullies and on SW facing slopes. Decreasing precipitation and wind on Tuesday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in the east part on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. Increased avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlæg átt og lítilsháttar úrkoma, rigning, slydda og snjókoma, um helgina. Norðlægari átt á mánudag og þurrt að kalla.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow expected next days in NE-snjowstorm and unstable wind slabs expected to form in S-W facing aspects. Older snow is uniform and stable after thaw followed by freezing.

snowpackStructure.highlights: During mild weather and rain January 10th-15th, the snow melted, settled, and layers broke down. Now temperatures have dropped below freezing, and snow should be stiff and stable. NE-snwstorm or snowshowers are forecast for the next few days. Unstable wind slabs may form in S-V facing aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in east Iceland on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. High avalanche danger is expected as the weather is passing, and wind slabs will likely form in gullies and on SW facing slopes. Decreasing precipitation and wind on Tuesday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in the east part on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. Increased avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.highlights: Spáð er frosti og éljagangi eða hríð í norðausta átt næstu daga.

avalancheActivity.comment: A snowmobile triggered an avalanche in Upsadalur west of Dalvik on Thursday January 9th. A natural avalanche fell in Dýjadalur, either on January 9th or 10th and a small slab in Karlsárdalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Unstable wind slabs expected after NE and E snowstorm. The old snow has subsided and strengthened due to thaw.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Unstable wind slabs expected after NE and E snowstorm on Saturday. It has snowed a bit in the last few days. Some snowfall is expected during strong E and NE wind. The old snow was most likely stable in most places.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in east Iceland on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. High avalanche danger is expected as the weather is passing, and wind slabs will likely form in gullies and on SW facing slopes. Decreasing precipitation and wind on Tuesday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in the east part on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. Increased avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.highlights: A-NA 13-20 m/s og snjókoma með köflum næstu daga.

avalancheActivity.comment: An avalanche released in Kambanesskriður in Breiðdalur on Jan 18th and a few sluffs in Bræðslugjár in Neskaupstaður. A small wet avalanche released in Fannardalur on Jan 12th.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Unstable wind slabs likely present after strong NE-E wind and snowfall on Saturday. More snowfall durin NE-wind on Sunday and Monday with further slab formation.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs are likely present, especially on S-W aspects and gullies, and observations indicate that the new snow is not bonding well with the older snow. Ongoing snowfall on Sunday and Monday, heavy at times, with increasing wind slab formation. Thick wind slabs could form in the mountains during heavy snowfall and drifting snow, and they could be unstable at first. Old hard packed snow is underneath.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in east Iceland on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. High avalanche danger is expected as the weather is passing, and wind slabs will likely form in gullies and on SW facing slopes. Decreasing precipitation and wind on Tuesday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger in the Eastfjords. Heavy snowfall and drifting snow in the east part on Sunday and Monday during strong NE winds. Increased avalanche danger.

weatherForecast.highlights: Á sunnudag hvessir smám saman af norðaustri og byrjar að snjóa. Áköf snjókoma í NA hvassviðri frá sunnudagskvöldi fram á mánudagskvöld. Dregur úr vindi og ofankomu á þriðjudag.
